main event: On May 9, 1957, in Tallmadge, Ohio, two or three round and black objects were seen heading north at a low altitude for 2 or 3 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed via Ground-Radar.
The description indicates that the sighting was probably caused by aircraft.
The sighting took place in broad daylight at 1416 hrs.
There is no additional report on file for further investigation.
The location and timing of the sighting are clearly documented.
sighted object: two or three round and black objects
